SEARCH
Package org.opengrok.indexer.analysis

Class JFlexXrefUtils

java.lang.Object
org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.JFlexXrefUtils
public class JFlexXrefUtils extends Object
Represents a container for extracted, shared logic between JFlexXref and its backwardly-compatible cousin, JFlexNonXref.

  • Method Details

    • appendLink

      public static void appendLink(Writer out, JFlexLexer lexer, String url, boolean doEndingPushback, Pattern collateralCapture) throws IOException
      Appends the url to the specified out Writer.

      If doEndingPushback is true, then StringUtils.countURIEndingPushback(java.lang.String) is enlisted for use with JFlexLexer.yypushback(int) -- i.e., url is only partially written.

      If collateralCapture is not null, then its match in url will alternatively mark the start of a count for pushback -- i.e., everything at and beyond the first collateralCapture match will be considered not to belong to the URI.

      If the pushback count is equal to the length of url, then it is simply written -- and nothing is pushed back -- in order to avoid a never-ending yylex() loop.

      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      lexer - a defined, associated lexer
      url - the URL to append
      doEndingPushback - a value indicating whether to test the url with StringUtils.countURIEndingPushback(java.lang.String)
      collateralCapture - optional pattern to indicate characters which may have been captured as valid URI characters but in a particular context should mark the start of a pushback
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while appending

    • appendProject

      public static void appendProject(Writer out, Project project) throws IOException
      Writes if project is not null an XML &amp; followed by the Project.getName() to the specified out Writer.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined instance
      project - possibly a defined instance or null
      Throws:
      IOException - if Writer.write(java.lang.String) fails

    • disjointSpan

      public static String disjointSpan(Writer out, String className, String currentDisjointSpanName) throws IOException
      Writes the closing of an open span tag -- if currentDisjointSpanName is not null -- and the opening -- if className is non-null -- of a new span tag.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      className - the class name for the new tag or null just to close an open tag.
      currentDisjointSpanName - possibly a defined instance or null
      Returns:
      className
      Throws:
      IOException - if an output error occurs

    • generateId

      public static String generateId(Scopes.Scope scope)
      Generate span id for namespace based on line number, name, and signature (more functions with same name and signature can be defined in single file).
      Parameters:
      scope - Scope to generate id from
      Returns:
      generated span id

    • maybeNewScope

      public static Scopes.Scope maybeNewScope(boolean scopesEnabled, Scopes.Scope existingScope, JFlexStackingLexer lexer, Definitions defs)
      Creates a new Scopes.Scope if scopesEnabled is true, existingScope is null, defs is not null, and Definitions.getTags(int) indicates that a function or method is defined to starting at the JFlexStackingLexer.getLineNumber() of lexer.
      Parameters:
      scopesEnabled - are scopes enabled ?
      existingScope - possibly a defined instance or null
      lexer - a defined, associated lexer
      defs - possibly a defined instance or null
      Returns:
      possibly a defined instance or null if a new scope is not to be set

    • writeEMailAddress

      public static void writeEMailAddress(Writer out, String address) throws IOException
      Write an e-mail address. The address will be obfuscated if RuntimeEnvironment.isObfuscatingEMailAddresses() returns true.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      address - the address to write
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the stream

    • writeSymbol

      public static boolean writeSymbol(Writer out, Definitions defs, String urlPrefix, Project project, String symbol, Set<String> keywords, int line, boolean caseSensitive, boolean isKeyword) throws IOException
      Writes a symbol and generate links as appropriate.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      defs - a possibly defined instance or null
      urlPrefix - a defined instance
      project - a possibly defined instance or null
      symbol - the symbol to write
      keywords - a set of keywords recognized by this analyzer (no links will be generated if the symbol is a keyword)
      line - the line number on which the symbol appears
      caseSensitive - Whether the keyword list is case sensitive
      isKeyword - Whether the symbol is certainly a keyword without bothering to look up in a defined keywords
      Returns:
      true if the symbol was not in keywords or if keywords was null and if-and-only-if isKeyword is false
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the stream

    • writeSameFileLinkSymbol

      public static void writeSameFileLinkSymbol(Writer out, String symbol) throws IOException
      Write a symbol with a link to its definition which is expected at exactly one location in the same file.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      symbol - the symbol to write
      Throws:
      IOException - if Writer.append(java.lang.CharSequence) fails

    • writeSymbolTable

      public static void writeSymbolTable(Writer out, Definitions defs) throws IOException
      Write a JavaScript function that returns an array with the definitions to list in the navigation panel. Each element of the array is itself an array containing the name of the definition type, the CSS class name for the type, and an array of (symbol, line) pairs for the definitions of that type.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      defs - a possibly defined instance or null
      Throws:
      IOException - if Writer.append(java.lang.CharSequence) fails

    • writeUnicodeChar

      public static void writeUnicodeChar(Writer out, char c) throws IOException
      Write HTML escape sequence for the specified Unicode character, unless it's an ISO control character, in which case it is ignored.
      Parameters:
      out - a defined, target instance
      c - the character to write
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the stream
